project.teaser: Long-haul BEVs and FCEVs need to become more affordable and reliable, more energy efficient, with a longer range per single charge, and a reduced charging time to meet the user’s needs. Next to those, there is a real need to take zero-emission long-haul goods transport in...
project.objective:
Long-haul BEVs and FCEVs need to become more affordable and reliable, more energy efficient, with a longer range per single charge, and a reduced charging time to meet the user’s needs. Next to those, there is a real need to take zero-emission long-haul goods transport in Europe to the next level by executing real-world demonstrations of BEVs and FCEVs spread all over Europe; this also requires that technology soon can deliver on promised benefits (easy handling, similar driving hours & charging/fueling, and high speeds, and ability to operate in complex transport supply chains); flexible and abundant charging points for the rising number of vehicles must be implemented fast and to support this, novel charging concepts are needed. In addition, as multiple needs in the logistics chain exist, require novel tools for fleet managers providing them with better information on ZEV in logistic operation, providing a twin of the real use thereby giving valuable information regarding predictive maintenance, eco-driving etc., providing information on better logistics planning, the (available) charging and refuelling along the route, access to roads and traffic information.
ZEFES major outcomes: Executing of real-world demonstrations of long-haul BEVs and FCEVs across Europe to take zero-emission long-haul goods transport in Europe to the next level. Pathway for long-haul BEVs and FCEVs to become more affordable and reliable, more energy efficient, with a longer range per single charge and reduced charging times able to meet the user’s needs. Technologies which can deliver promised benefits (easy handling, similar driving hours & charging/fueling, high speeds and ability to operate in complex transport supply chains). Mapping of flexible and abundant charging/fueling points and novel charging concepts. Novel tools for fleet management to support the rising number of long-haul BEVs and FCEVs vehicles in the logistics supply chains.
project.title: Zero Emission flexible vehicle platforms with modular powertrains serving the long-haul Freight Eco System

article.title: How to further improve electric long-haul freight transportation within Europe

article.teaser: Ford Trucks’ fuel cell-powered lorry is a key step on the path to EU-backed ZEFES project’s goal to help decarbonise Europe’s long-haul goods transport.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - ZEFES (Zero Emission flexible vehicle platforms with modular powertrains serving the long-haul Freight Eco System)
result.teaser: Long-haul BEVs and FCEVs need to become more affordable and reliable, more energy efficient, with a longer range per single charge, and a reduced charging time to meet the user’s needs. Next to those, there is a real need to take zero- emission long-haul goods transport in...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Design of the interface between b-trailer and prime mover
result.description: This deliverable will report on the analysis of energy needs and battery integration for truck & trailer (VC8).

result.title: Technical requirements
result.description: Technical needs and requirements for BEV and FCEV combinations. This deliverable is related to T1.1.

result.title: Supply chain mapping
result.description: This deliverable will show the mapping of the ZEFES use cases at a supply chain level. This deliverable is related to T1.3.

result.title: Assessment framework
result.description: This deliverable will be a report on the assessment framework for baseline assessment, use case evaluation, interface requirements and data requirements for vehicles, infrastructure and logistic during the demonstrations.

result.title: Design of the interface between e-trailer and prime mover
result.description: This deliverable reports on the analysis of energy needs and battery integration for truck & trailer including design of operation strategies to increase range (VC8).

result.title: ZERO EMISSION, FLEXIBLE VEHICLE PLATFORMS WITH MODULAR POWERTRAINS SERVING THE LONG-HAUL FREIGHT ECOSYSTEM (ZEFES)
Digital twin and platform specification & architecture
result.description: This deliverable will be a report on the digital twin and platform specification & architecture, including selection of tools, scaling of models, model fidelity, run time and usage assessment. This deliverable is related to activities in T4.1/T4.2, VC16 and VC17.

result.title: Feasibility study on new vehicle flexible concepts
result.description: This deliverable will report on the feasibility study on new vehicle flexible concepts for payload capacity up to 100% for next LHDV generations. This deliverable is related to activities in T2.5

result.title: Infrastructure model/dataset (V2I Concept)
result.description: This deliverable will be a report on the infrastructure model/dataset (V2I Concept). This deliverable is related to VC13 and T4.4.

result.title: Vehicle simulation platforms
result.description: This deliverable will report on the vehicle simulation platforms for BEV, FCEV and trailer combinations. This deliverable is related to activities in T2.2.

result.title: ZEFES ecosystem specification
result.description: This deliverable will show the ZEFES ecosystem specification, including the use case KPI needs, stakeholder business needs, consolidation towards consistent system, and TCO. This deliverable is realted to T1.3, 1.4, 1.5.

result.title: Simulation performance of demonstrators
result.description: This deliverable will report on the simulation performance of the demonstrators, including the impact on their innovations via vehicle digital twin model.

result.title: Functional Safety Concept
result.description: This deliverable will be a report on the functional safety concept for e-trucks, e-dollies and e-trailers for use in vehicles with a distributed zero emission powertrain.

result.title: System specification for ZE modular multi-powertrain concepts
result.description: This deliverable will report the system specification for ZE modular multi-powertrain concepts. This specification will be verified by the contributing OEMs and trailer manufacturers, specifying the efficiency improvements for the multi-powertrain according to VC9.

result.title: Defined Use Cases, Target metrics and needs
result.description: This deliverable will define the KPIs per use case on energy savings and mission efficiency. The deliverable is related to T1.2.

result.title: Corporate Identity
result.description: This deliverable will be a report on the project's corporate Identity. This includes the project website, project flyer design, etc.

result.title: Optimization co-design tool and right powertrain component’ sizing
result.description: This deliverable reports on the design optimization tool (VC10) and right powertrain components’ sizing with at least 90 payload capacity for use-cases. This deliverable is related to activities in T2.3 and T2.4.

result.title: Supply chain needs
result.description: This deliverable will report the supply chain needs for reduced energy usage on the missions. This deliverable is related to T1.7.

result.title: Energies

details.authors: Shantanu Pardhi; Sajib Chakraborty; Dai-Duong Tran; Mohamed El Baghdadi; Steven Wilkins; Omar Hegazy

result.title: A Modular Model for Determining Cornering Resistance of Heavy-Duty Vehicles

details.authors: Alenka Beckers, Camiel Beckers, Paul Mentink, Igo Besselink, Steven Wilkins

result.title: Financing an accelerated shift to zero emission vehicles by deploying High-Capacity Transport with Intelligent Access by 2024

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
